      • htmlFor

        @NotNull
HtmlBuilderTargetSelector<java.lang.String> htmlFor()
        Finishes configuring rendering options and renders html for the target selected using the returned selector. This method is automatically called from the Object.toString() on this object (together with the method on the selector) when the "implicit target" is set. Currently the implicit target is set when rendering the RichPageWidget. So for example in Velocity widget you can (and should) render Work Item by calling just $workItem.render(). Actually in widgets you should always do it like that or render to the builder created by RichPageRenderingContext.createHtmlFragmentBuilder() because it ensures that the right target is used.
        Specified by:
        htmlFor in interface BasicRenderer

      • htmlTo

        void htmlTo(@NotNull
            HtmlContentBuilder builder)
        Finishes configuring rendering options and renders html to the given builder
        Specified by:

T withRevisionIcon(boolean value)
        Default value is true when the method is not called
